modules.description: Converts XML signals to polyglot (X)HTML5 by processing signal lists through a stream context, handling document detection and output formatting. Operates on XML signal lists and XML output sinks, supporting both direct and smart document output. Enables streaming of structured markup with optional indentation, newlines, and namespace handling.

Converts XML trees into valid (X)HTML5 polyglot markup using functions that handle element tagging, namespace prefixes, and indentation. Processes trees structured with data nodes and element tags, supporting both standalone and embedded document outputs. Outputs complete HTML documents with proper DOCTYPE or treats inputs as XML when insufficient document structure is detected.

Provides functions to parse and evaluate expressions in multiple programming languages, including arithmetic operations, variable substitution, and conditional logic. Works with abstract syntax trees and language-specific lexers to process input strings. Used to implement cross-language expression evaluation in scripting environments and configuration parsers.

Processes XML signal lists and trees to generate valid (X)HTML5 polyglot markup, handling document detection, namespace prefixes, and indentation. Accepts XML signal lists and XML trees as input, producing structured output through stream contexts or complete documents. Supports direct and smart output modes, including DOCTYPE declarations and embedded content. Enables streaming of formatted markup with namespace-aware element tagging and flexible document handling.
